item.title: Marvel Rivals Is Celebrating Another Milestone With A Free Limited-Time Reward
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/marvel-rivals-is-celebrating-another-milestone-with-a-free-limited-time-reward/1100-6528532/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

NetEase has revealed that Marvel Rivals has hit another player count milestone and is giving away a free in-game gift to celebrate it.

The gift is a spray of a chibi version of Galactica, the game's narrator, as she holds party streamers and with the text "20 million rivals" at the bottom.

"We are thrilled to announce that 20 million players have joined Marvel Rivals! Our gratitude for each of you is immense," NetEase said in a Tweet. "The spray is ready now, and we also included this number in the spray! Thank you for helping us achieve this milestone." Players who log in from December 20, 2024 to January 10, 2025 can claim it.

üíñ We are thrilled to announce that 20 million players have joined Marvel Rivals! Our gratitude for each of you is immense!
ü•∞The spray is ready now, and we also included this number in the spray! Thank you for helping us achieve this milestone.
‚è≤Ô∏èLog in from December 20th,‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/tr0k6NYZ95

‚Äî Marvel Rivals (@MarvelRivals) December 17, 2024

Marvel Rivals has been a breakout hit since its release earlier this month. In the game's first 72 hours of launch, it reached 10 million players. Its first event is a winter update coming later this week, and it features new skins and a Jeff-centric mode.

NetEase knows that cross-progression is a very popularly requested feature and is currently working on finding a way to implement it. However, the studio said that it's likely not coming any time soon.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Overwatch 2's Winter Wonderland Returns, Along With 6v6 Experimentation
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/overwatch-2s-winter-wonderland-returns-along-with-6v6-experimentation/1100-6528531/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Blizzard has announced that Overwatch 2's Winter Wonderland update kicks off today, December 17, and that it brings back some winter-themed playlists, along with 6v6 battles.

In the Arcade, players can face off against each other in three different winter brawls, such as Mei's Snowball Offensive. Here, snowballs will continually fly across the screen when playing 5v5 elimination and free-for-all matches. In Mei's Yeti Hunt, five players must work together to lay down traps and capture the Yeti, who his Winston in his Yeti skin.

Freeze Flash Elimination is Overwatch 2's version of freeze tag, where players who get frozen can rejoin the match by having their teammates thaw them out.

Overwatch 2's 6v6 experiment has also begun on the King's Row map. It'll be in role queue format, with 2-2-2 rules, meaning that teams need to be split into an equal number of tanks, damage, and support characters. The experiment will last until January 6.

There are also plenty of new holiday-themed skins to earn for characters. Playing three, six, and nine games will reward you with the Merry Marionette Echo Legendary, Cassidy's legendary, and Widowmaker's legendary skins, respectively.

Some games received holiday and winter-themed updates recently--this month, Stellar Blade and Astro Bot have gotten their own.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
